content: take two granny squares add a few row here and there and voila you have yourself a tank top the body length is adjustable depending on whether you want a longer top or a more cropped top for those trendy pre-teens all seams are joined with the jayg join-as-you-go technique so there is no sewing apart from sewing in your ends **method ** this tank top is constructed by making two granny squares adding shoulder tabs joining the shoulder and side seams and adding length to the body ribbing is then added at the neck armholes and bottom hem to complete the garment this pattern uses uk terminology and the following stitches chain slip_stitch double_crochet half treble_crochet treble_crochet back post half treble_crochet and front post half treble_crochet the pattern also includes charts and diagrams **size ** this pattern is written in 4 sizes all instructions that differ depending on the size you are crocheting are color coded and indicated with parentheses like this 1 2 3 and 4 size - age - child s chest - finished garment chest 1 - 1 to 3 years - 46-53 cm 18-21 - 57 cm 22 5 2 - 4 to 5 years - 55-61 cm 22-24 - 65 cm 25 5 3 - 6 to 8 years - 63 5-68 5 cm 25-27 - 72 cm 28 5 4 - 9 - 11 years - 68 5-76 cm 27-30 - 80 cm 31 5 **yarn ** this pattern was written for the new cygnet pato everyday prints dk however you can use any dk yarn that you like and **with which you can get gauge/ gauge ** yarn a pato everyday prints 690 rainbow x 2 balls yarn b pato everyday dk 999 white x 1 ball **gauge ** 8 round granny square = 17 75 cm 7 5 granny clusters and 9 row to 10 cm 4 in
